intro: Daiotyla rhodotyla, commonly known as the red-leafed cycad, is a unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Cycadaceae family and is characterized by its stout, unbranched trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant's leaves are typically a vibrant red or orange when young, gradually turning green as they mature. Daiotyla rhodotyla is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant.
